description: Base questions that determine the flow of subsequent detailed questions for business tax profiles.

questions.questionText: What type of business entity is this?
questions.explanation: Different business entities have different tax obligations and rates. Companies are taxed at 30% (or 0% if small), while partnerships and sole proprietorships are taxed at individual rates.
questions.helpText: Select the legal structure of your business. This determines how your business income is taxed.

questions.questionText: What is your annual business turnover?
questions.explanation: Small companies (turnover ≤ ₦50M and fixed assets ≤ ₦250M, excluding professional services) pay 0% tax. Other companies pay 30%. This classification affects your tax rate.
questions.helpText: Select based on your annual business revenue. Small companies have different tax rates.

questions.questionText: What are your main business activities?
questions.explanation: Different business activities may have different tax treatments. Agricultural businesses get 5-year exemption, exports may have special incentives, and professional services cannot be classified as small companies.
questions.helpText: Select all activities your business engages in. This helps determine applicable tax rules and incentives.

questions.questionText: What types of expenses does your business have?
questions.explanation: Business expenses are deductible and reduce your taxable profit. Capital assets qualify for capital allowances (depreciation deductions). R&D expenses can be deducted up to 5% of turnover.
questions.helpText: Select all expense categories your business incurs. This helps identify all deductible expenses.

questions.explanation: If you have employees, you have employer obligations including PAYE (deducting tax from salaries), pension contributions, and NHF contributions. These are separate from business income tax.
questions.helpText: Answer 'Yes' if you employ staff, even if it's just one person.

questions.questionText: Do any of these apply to your business?
options: Export processing or free trade zone entity
questions.explanation: Specialized businesses and priority sectors may have different tax rates, exemptions, or incentives. These require specific forms and calculations.
questions.helpText: Select all that apply. Specialized businesses have specific tax treatments.

note: After these base questions, detailed questions will be asked based on answers. Business TIN collection happens after base questions, before detailed income/expense collection.
